definitions.definition: (often followed by up) To stop sleeping.
definitions.example: I woke up at four o'clock this morning.

definitions.definition: (often followed by up) To make somebody stop sleeping; to rouse from sleep.
definitions.example: The neighbour's car alarm woke me from a strange dream.

definitions.definition: To put in motion or action; to arouse; to excite.
To be excited or roused up; to be stirred up from a dormant, torpid, or inactive state; to be active.
To lay out a body prior to burial in order to allow family and friends to pay their last respects.
To watch, or sit up with, at night, as a dead body.
To be or remain awake; not to sleep.
To be alert; to keep watch
definitions.example: Command unto the guards that they diligently wake.

definitions.definition: To sit up late for festive purposes; to hold a night revel.
